text: anyone know a way to do native emoji support? i.e. not using an image sprite like ember-cli-emoji

Sure, they’re around as Unicode characters, some of which have existed for a while.
<http://apps.timwhitlock.info/emoji/tables/unicode>
(Please consider Linux support for some of the newer glyphs)

attachments.title: Emoji unicode characters for use on the web
attachments.text: Emoji code points and example glyphs using web fonts, sprites and native OS representation of Emoji characters
attachments.fallback: apps.timwhitlock.info: Emoji unicode characters for use on the web

text: yeah I’m going with like 4 of the fairly standard ones so Linux isn’t a big issue
tried native and it didn’t work
